summary: I'm a researcher assistant with a passion for social activism and community building. With a background in cultural studies, think tank research, and human rights activism, I have developed experience in advocating for vulnerable groups, and eagerly look forward to developing my career within the emerging field of intersectionality and social laboratories. I'm a collaborative team player who enjoys working across multiple domains and creating solidarity networks. Spanish and Mexican roots, living in the city of Tilburg, The Netherlands.

profile_positions.company: Tlatelolco LAB, Digital Laboratory for Democracy
profile_positions.description: At Tlatelolco LAB, I contribute as an assistant researcher, focusing on human rights research for impact litigation. My work involves comparative law research and supporting online and offline activities. I am deeply engaged in learning about the challenges to democracy in Latin America, including the political use of social media, fake news, and radicalization. Additionally, I explore community-building processes aimed at articulating social movements and fostering positive change.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant of the Tlatelolco Lab, Digital Laboratory for Democracy

profile_positions.description: As a co-founder of the Ecosophic Lab, an international project dedicated to fostering social laboratories, I help create non-conventional spaces that promote transversal perspectives for transforming the public sphere. Our approach connects diverse stakeholders and takes inspiration from contemporary practices such as deschooling, relationship anarchy, networks of solidarity, legal pluralism, and utopic fictions. Our mission is to generate new sensibilities and affections, ultimately giving rise to a fresh social ecology that drives meaningful change.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder of Ecosophic Lab, International Network of Social Experimentation

profile_positions.description: In my previous role at the "Technical Analysis of National Matters" journal, I focused on addressing national issues in Mexico from a technical legal perspective. My responsibilities included conducting comparative legal research, monitoring news media coverage, and developing research proposals for publication. I also contributed to editing work for the journal's publications. Additionally, I connected with and interviewed expert opinions, ensuring our content remained insightful and authoritative.
profile_positions.title: Editor and Research Assistant for the academic journal Technical Analysis of National Matters

profile_positions.description: In my previous role as Assistant to the former President of the National Human Rights Commission, I worked within the National System of Researchers for three years. I was responsible for coordinating three distinct editorial projects related to constitutional law and human rights. Leading a team of six interns, I ensured smooth collaboration and effective communication with other senior researchers involved in these projects. My role contributed to the advancement of human rights research and the dissemination of valuable insights in the field.
profile_positions.title: Assistant to the former President of the National Human Rights Commission of Mexico, Ombudsperson.

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a Greenpeace activist, I fervently participated in diverse climate change initiatives, collaborating with communities and organizations nationwide. My duties entailed training new volunteers to effectively contribute with essential knowledge and skills. Aboard the iconic Rainbow Warrior in Veracruz, my dedication to environmental advocacy and activism was further reinforced. The following interview was part of our campaign about soil and bees: 
https://www.facebook.com/greenpeacemexico/videos/dia-2-de-alertaabeja/10155413126640275/

In my role as an activist with The Humane League, an international organization dedicated to promoting vegan implementation and compassionate practices, I was involved in both political activism and digital campaigns. I worked alongside the organization to engage directly with companies, helping them explore alternatives for transitioning towards more ethical models that prioritize animal welfare and reduce harm.

El Caracol is a philanthropic organization located in the heart of Mexico City. The organization is dedicated to advocating for the social and human rights of individuals facing homelessness. My involvement included providing legal defense and conducting comprehensive ethnographic and demographic research.

During my time as Volunteer Research Assistant in Mercy for Animals, an international vegan organization committed to promoting non-violent food production practices, I contributed to a short project focused on comparative domestic law. My work centered on exploring the implementation of vegan meal options in public schools, supporting the organization's mission to create a more compassionate and sustainable food system for the benefit of both animals and the environment.
